snippet: President Park Geun-hye’s overture came five days after the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, urged the creation of “a favorable climate for improved relations.”
abstract: South Korean Pres Park Geun-hye proposes that the two Koreas resume the reunions of families separated since the Korean War.
lead_paragraph: President Park Geun-hye’s overture came five days after the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, urged the creation of “a favorable climate for improved relations.”

headline.main: South Korea Proposes Resuming Reunions of War-Divided Families
